item.title: c0ffee - Web Developer Hexadecimal Color Code Design
item.description: In web development languages like HTML and CSS hexadecimal codes can be used to encode colors. This design shows the hex code “#c0ffee”, leetspeak for coffee, the drink that fuels developers, in the corresponding color. / If you appreciate a...

item.title: Wife is Always Right Funny CSS Design for Designers & Developers

item.title: #BADA55 - CSS Color Humor for Web Developers & Designers
item.description: Hexadecimal color values are supported in all major web browsers and thus frequently used to assign colors in HTML, CSS or JavaScript code. In the web context hexadecimal color codes are preceded by a hash or pound sign. / This design is for badass web...

item.title: When Web Developers Need Irish Coffee

item.title: CSS Class Ninja White on Black Design for Web Developers
item.description: Legend tells that ninjas train invisibility, walking on water, and control over the natural elements. The CSS ninja has to master control over Web browsers which for some may feel like an even bigger challenge. / A design for Web developers/designers with...

item.title: BROWSER WAR VETERAN - Green on Army Design for Web Developers
item.description: The first browser war happened during the late 1990s and the main opponents were Microsoft Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator. If you developed for the World Wide Web in those dark ages you’re a true Browser War Veteran. / The fight for browser...
